page.title: 19MORE OLD HOUSES IN CLOPHILL
page.content: Parts of the brick buildings which form{34 High Street}go back to{Tudor times, with many later additions. It was used as a butcher shop & slaughter house, later it was a hat factory. It is now a private house, the old{pump can still be seen in the garden. { 19 High Street}is built of local brick & was formerly a dairy farm. The {pump}in the front yard was last used in{1942.}Mrs.Robinson was born here & went to our school until she was 14. She then sold milk by ladling it in measures from a pail into a jug. The cows were kept in the field behind the school & milked twice daily at no.19. Other notable buildings, although not houses, are the{lock-up}where drunks were incarcerated until they were sober, & the{pound}where stray animals were kept until they were claimed.
